summary: This document is an email chain from April 2019 regarding a procurement issue at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It involves a vendor (Anixter) requiring a credit application to proceed with an order for fiber cable and camera systems, and internal Bureau of Prisons communication about the delay. The document is marked as sensitive but appears to be a routine administrative matter unrelated to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Al Cutler
persons.context: An account manager for the vendor Anixter, providing instructions on how to set up a credit account to proceed with an order.

events.title: Vendor Credit Application Request
events.description: An account manager from Anixter sends an email requesting the recipient fill out an online credit application to proceed with an order for fiber cable and camera systems.

locations: MCC-New York 150 Park Row New York, NY 10007-1704
Metropolitan Correctional CTR 150 Park Row New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a routine administrative email chain concerning a procurement delay at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York in April 2019.
The delay is due to a vendor, Anixter, requiring a credit application to be filled out before shipping fiber cable needed for camera systems.
The document is marked with a sensitive communication warning from the U.S. Department of Justice, but its content is unrelated to Jeffrey Epstein or his case.

The document references file EFTA00126259 and EFTA00126260, indicating it is part of a larger document set released in the Epstein case, though its direct relevance is not apparent from the text provided.
